magic.connectors.metrics.title: Usage information
magic.connectors.metrics.description: The data below displays current usage. The graph shows usage from the hour.
magic.connectors.metrics.error_fetching_: There was an error fetching your data
magic.connectors.metrics.cpuLoadPercenta: The percentage of total Magic WAN Connector CPU time dedicated to running processes. If the CPU load percent is above 100%, there are processes waiting in the queue that cannot be run. A healthy range for CPU load is between 30% - 70%.
The temperature of the Magic WAN Connector CPU in degrees Celsius.
magic.connectors.metrics.diskUsagePercen: The percentage of used space on the Magic WAN Connectoru2019s disk drive.
magic.connectors.metrics.memoryUsagePerc: The percentage of memory currently dedicated to processes on the Magic WAN Connector.
magic.policies.lan.title: LAN policies
magic.policies.lan.description: Define how traffic flows between LANs without leaving your local network.
magic.policies.lan.table.name: Name
magic.policies.lan.table.no_policies_des: There are currently no LAN policies for this site.
magic.policies.form.title: Magic LAN Policy
magic.policies.form.input.name: Policy name
magic.policies.delete.confirm.title: Delete %{name}
magic.policies.delete.confirm.descriptio: Are you sure you would like to delete this policy?
magic.policies.delete.confirm.checkbox: I understand that deleting a policy is permanent.
magic.policies.form.input.traffic.path.t: Checking this box will send inter-LAN traffic through Cloudflare's network for filtering. By default, it's allowed locally on your Magic WAN Connector.
magic.interconnects.title: Interconnects
magic.interconnects.create.panel.title: What CNI type would you like to set up?
magic.interconnects.create.panel.descrip: Select one of the following interconnect types to begin
magic.interconnects.cni.types.title: Types of CNIs
magic.interconnects.description: Securely connect your network directly to Cloudflare for improved network speed, and lower packet loss and latency. Available for Magic WAN and Magic Transit customers.
magic.interconnects.cni.contact: Contact your implementation manager for setup
magic.interconnects.cni.details.title: Interconnect details
magic.interconnects.cni.direct.title: Direct CNI
magic.interconnects.cni.virtual.title: Partner CNI
magic.interconnects.cni.cloud.title: Cloud CNI
magic.interconnects.cni.edit.title: Edit Interconnect
magic.interconnects.cni.edit.name.label: CNI interface name
magic.interconnects.cni.edit.name.invali: Name must be 15 or less characters, and cannot contain spaces or special characters
magic.interconnects.cni.info.direct.subt: Protect your on-premise data center. Order a cross connect to directly connect your router to Cloudflare.
magic.interconnects.cni.info.direct.desc: Connect to Cloudflare with a hardwired cable
Select a compatible data center where you have existing hardware.
Choose the interconnect speed that best fits your traffic needs.
Cloudflare will provide you with a Letter of Authorization to order a cross connect.
magic.interconnects.cni.info.virtual.sub: Protect your on-premise data center. Connect your router to Cloudflare through a connectivity partner.
magic.interconnects.cni.info.virtual.des: Connect via fabric with partners like Equinix and Megaport
Use a connectivity partner to provide interconnection to Cloudflare
Partners include Equinix, Megaport, ConsoleConnect, Epsilon, CoreSite, and PacketFabric.
Existing partner CNIs are not visible on the Cloudflare dashboard.
magic.interconnects.cni.info.virtual.hel: Contact your implementation manager to set up a partner CNI.
magic.interconnects.cni.info.cloud.title: Cloud CNIs
magic.interconnects.cni.info.cloud.subti: Connect and protect your public cloud environment with Cloudflare.
magic.interconnects.cni.info.cloud.descr: Connect Cloudflare to your public cloud infrastructure
Connect Cloudflare to your public cloud environment to accelerate and protect your infrastructure.
Support for: AWS, Google Cloud, Oracle Cloud, and IBM Cloud. Azure is coming soon.
Existing Cloud CNIs are not visible on the Cloudflare dashboard.
magic.interconnects.cni.info.cloud.help: Contact your implementation manager to set up a cloud CNI.
magic.interconnects.wizard.title: Add a new Direct CNI
magic.interconnects.wizard.description: Create a new CNI to directly connect your network to Cloudflare within your data center or colocation facility. Cloudflare will authorize your cross connect.
magic.interconnects.wizard.select-dc.des: Search for your data center or colocation facility address to see if Cloudflare is in the same building.
magic.interconnects.wizard.select-dc.inp: Enter the city, state or country of your preferred data center
Search by city, state, or country
Select your required interface speed and name your interconnect.
Best for networks with traffic under one gigabit per second.
Best for networks with traffic between 2-10 gigabits per second.
Please name your interface (you can edit this later)
Contact your implementation manager for 100 gigabit options
Note: Please ensure your network router is compatible with the available interconnect speeds
Name must be 15 or less characters
Name cannot contain spaces or special characters
magic.interconnects.wizard.confirm.title: Review & confirm
magic.interconnects.wizard.confirm.descr: Please verify the interface speed, and that your network is located in the same facility as the CNI. When you confirm your order, Cloudflare will issue you a Letter of Authorization for the cross connect, and issue IP addresses for the circuit.
Cloudflare will issue you a LOA for your CNI %{name} and allocate IPs for the circuit.
Please download and keep this letter for your records.
Contact smart hands to order a cross connect
Provide your colocation (or data center), with the Cloudflare Letter of Authorization to order your cross connect.
magic.interconnects.wizard.download.desc: Download this letter of authorization to use as reference when ordering a cross connect to Cloudflareu2019s data center. Patch/panel numbers can be found within LOA
magic.interconnects.wizard.download.info: Please contact your colocation facility smart hands and provide them with the Letter of Authorization to order a cross connect
magic.interconnects.wizard.download.desc: Cloudflare will activate your connection within 3 minutes. Once your cross connection is patched, you may configure and IP address on your router interface.
You can view and manage your CNI from the Interconnects menu. You can redownload the LOA later, and view the IP address information.
magic.interconnects.wizard.help: Need help? Follow our <0>set-up documentation</0> or <1>visit our support portal</1>.
magic.overview.alerts.title: Alerts
magic.overview.title: Traffic
magic.overview.total_sent.tooltip: The traffic volume leaving a Magic WAN site over the selected time period.
magic.overview.total_received.tooltip: The traffic volume entering a Magic WAN site over the selected time period.
magic.overview.error.loading_traffic: We were unable to load traffic
magic.overview.description: Visibility on all your sites connected to Cloudflareu2019s network and data exchanged by them.
Showing total volume of traffic sent and received by your sites.
magic.overview.healthcheck.map.descripti: Select a site to view details.
magic.overview.healthcheck.status.health: %{smart_count} site is healthy |||| %{smart_count} sites are healthy
magic.overview.healthcheck.status.unheal: %{smart_count} site is unhealthy |||| %{smart_count} sites are unhealthy
magic.overview.healthcheck.status.none_c: %{smart_count} site has no status available |||| %{smart_count} sites have no status available
magic.overview.healthcheck.status.none.t: You must set notifications for the site's tunnels to see the status
Configure tunnels for this site to get current status
magic.overview.traffic_overview.no_sites: Traffic overview will appear here once you configured at least one site with an activated connector and added notificiations to your tunnels.

%{smart_count} tunnel is unhealthy |||| %{smart_count} tunnels are unhealthy

magic.overview.detail.site_traffic.title: %{siteName} Traffic Analytics
magic.overview.detail.site_traffic.no_da: We have no data available for the selected time
magic.tunnels.healthcheck.title: Tunnel Health
magic.tunnels.healthcheck.description: Tunnel health checks monitor the status of Anycast tunnels that route traffic from Cloudflare to your origin network. Magic Transit uses health checks to steer traffic to the best available routes.
magic.tunnels.healthcheck.table.empty_de: No tunnels have been configured for this account
magic.account.address_space.configuratio: When route propagation is on for a cloud on-ramp, Cloudflare will install the below CIDR prefixes to your cloud network route tables to direct traffic to Magic WAN. To learn how to install default routes to direct all traffic from your VPC to Magic WAN, click <0>here</0>.
magic.firewall.rate_limit.rules.title: Rate limiting rules
magic.firewall.rate_limit.rules.descript: Manage the custom rate limiting rules currently deployed to your network.
